result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott L Gregory

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Scott L Gregory appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Scott L Gregory.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Griffis provides an update; he has had discussions with the State and they plan to file another misdemeanor case.  Atty. Campbell expects the initial charge to be filed very soon, but is not sure when the initial appearance date would occur.  Atty. Campbell requests this matter be set out for further proceedings with enough time to allow the new case to catch up.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. Griffis requesting his client be able to appear by Zoom for the 11/2/2022 Hearing. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 10/31/22 - Approved.**

10:30 AM; Case called for Hearing. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.   Defendant Scott L Gregory appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Scott L Gregory. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Griffis provides an update; he has received initial discovery but is waiting on some digital discovery as well as an offer.  Atty. Griffis requests another further proceedings in about 30 days.  State has no objection and will route the file to the ADA assigned with respect to digital discovery and an offer.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. Griffis requesting the defendant be allowed to appear by Zoom for the 9/30/2022 Hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/29/22 - Approved.**

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 9/1/22.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A (including Victim A's business on Hickory Street) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

8:42 AM Defendant Scott L Gregory in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
